short_summary: Data needs assessment for offshore wind in Atlantic Canada
description: An assessment of the data needs for the development of offshore wind energy in Atlantic Canada.
full_summary:
Government of Canada Tender Announcement
===============================

**Project Title**
----------------

* English: Data needs assessment for offshore wind in Atlantic Canada.
* French: Évaluation des besoins en données pour l’énergie éolienne extracôtière dans la région du Canada atlantique.

**Reference Number**
-------------------

* 5281

**Solicitation Number**
----------------------

* NRCan-5000073005

**Publication Date**
-------------------

* May 5, 2023

**Deadline for Receipt of Bids**
--------------------------------

* June 7, 2023, 14h00 (EDT)

**Project Description**
----------------------

The primary objective of this project is to conduct a comprehensive data needs assessment for offshore wind development in Atlantic Canada. The analysis will focus on regions in Nova Scotia and Newfoundland with greater likelihood of near-term offshore wind development, while considering future data needs for the broader Atlantic Canada region.

**Requirements**
----------------

The project requires identifying all types of metocean data needed to enable offshore wind development in Atlantic Canada, and recommending and specifying appropriate measures to collect this data.

**Key Deliverables**
--------------------

* A report summarizing the data needs assessment, including recommendations for the collection of metocean data.

**Competition**
----------------

* The project will be issued on a competitive, open bidding basis.

**Selection Criteria**
----------------------

* Evaluation of bid proposals will be based on the following criteria:
	+ Technical proposal
	+ Methodology
	+ Experience

**Contracting Authority**
------------------------

* Natural Resources Canada (NRCan)
* Contact: Brenda Harlow (brenda.harlow@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)
* Address: 580 Booth street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E4
* Phone: 999-999-999
* Fax: N/A

You can obtain more information by visiting [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca) or by contacting Brenda Harlow by email or phone. You can also download the bid documents from the above website.  The following documents are available: * Request for Proposal (rfp),* Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Requirements (QR) documents, * Amendment (AMD) document * RFP document.

Please note that this project is closed to bids as it has expired. 

Let me know how I can improve the entry further. Thank you.  I plan to associate similar templates of the tender notice to aid me in standard creation.
